intro: Cheilanthes obtusata, commonly known as the blunt-tipped rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is a terrestrial fern that typically grows in rocky or crevice habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant has a short, thick rhizome with a dense covering of brown, velvety scales. Its fronds are pinnately compound, with lanceolate to elliptic pinnae that are often slightly curled at the tips. The species is characterized by its ability to thrive in harsh environments, making it a common sight in rocky outcrops and dry landscapes.
